body: Dead Painters SÃ©ance ~ The spirit is weak but the body is strong.

name: {image.name||}
title: Dead Painters SÃ©ance ~ You are lost

credits.html.candle:
{credits_1} {credits_2} {credits_3}
Back
credits.html.credits_1:
Dead Painters SÃ©ance is developed by Wetgenes, Prekshaa Malu & Priyanka Raju Parulekar.

{game_info}

Priyanka and Prekshaa. Private photo.

Prekshaa Malu and Priyanka Parulekar are an unlikely duo that became pandemic friends on social media. They share similar thoughts on art, literature, philosophy, mental health, gender identity and sexuality. Together they represent the growing struggles and joys of millennial and Gen-Z women in the current world, coming from the maximum city of Mumbai, India. Besides, both are loving cat moms to Lucky and Euro.

Prekshaa is a content strategist and communications manager. She has 10+ years of experience in the media industry. At the beginning, she was a journalist covering the Art& Culture segment for Mumbaiâs leading news publications. She creates abstract self-portraits as a hobby.

Priyanka is a student of psychology, literature, and philosophy. She is a writer and art enthusiast. She is passionate about accessibility and has formed a thriving community for neurodivergent folks in India. Born and brought up in Mumbai, she writes in three languages, English, Hindi, and Marathi, and is learning a fourth, French. She hopes to make unfettered access to art for everyone a reality.

Wetgenes. Private photo.

Kriss and shi Blank make up Wetgenes, an ineffable ontology project based in Bradford. Feral game developers working across sound and visual arts. They can usually be found tinkering or building things in and around unexpected places in the city they live in.

Music: Away by MeydÃ¤n is licensed under a CC BY 4.0 Deed Attribution License.
credits.html.credits_2: NEO Collections is funded by the German Federal Cultural Foundation as part of their Digital Culture programme. Funded by the German Federal Government Commissioner for Culture and Media.
credits.html.credits_3:
Funded by the Digital Culture Programme of the German Federal Cultural Foundation
Funded by the Federal Government Commissioner for Culture and the Media
credits.html.game_info:
The Dead Painters SÃ©ance is an exploration of using AI generative text to connect a modern audience to forgotten artists.
It uses content from the National Portrait Gallery of Sweden and is part of the NEO Collections project.
credits.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance000.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance010.html.candle:
You find yourself in a dark room filled with the endless twinkling of distant stars. The constellations are not familiar with your own. You feel a sturdy, wooden chair in front of you and a voice beckons you to sit.
Sit
seance010.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance020.html.candle:
Voice
It's dark in here, isn't it? There is a candle floating around here somewhere. Shall we light it up?
Yes
seance020.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance030.html.candle:
Voice
Oh ~ that's much better ... Be still, I sense a disturbance. Something is near.
Wait
seance030.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance040.html.candle:
Voice
Behold ~ there are spirits abound and they seem attracted to the candle. Capture one?
CATCH
seance040.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance050.html.css:
.img	{animation:half_show 2s steps(40,end),glitch 2s infinite linear alternate-reverse; mask-image:linear-gradient(to top, transparent 25%, black);}
.talky	{animation:slower_show 1.5s steps(140,end);}
seance050.html.q1:
Voice
It looks like you've captured a {emotion} spirit. It is, however, weak so it needs to resonate with your humanity in order to manifest.
Resonate
seance050.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance060.html.candle:
The spirit is barely visible ~ you can almost see it's silhoutte if you squint. Trembling , it looks at you and starts to speak; a soft hesitant whisper at first before fully formed words come spilling out.
...
seance060.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance070.html.q1:
Spirit
Hello?? Where am I?
Is anybody there? Can you help me?
...
seance070.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance080.html.q1:
Spirit
I need to remember.
I need to remember what it is to be alive.
...
seance080.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance090.html.q1:
Spirit
Will you help me?
Will you please answer my questions?
Ok
seance090.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance100.html.candle:
The spirit looks at you, hopeful. You realise that agreeing to answer whatever questions they might ask would come with perhaps, dire consequences. It could have been a trick of the light but you thought you saw it smirk for a moment. Then it spoke again.
...
seance100.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

{question}
{answer}
seance110.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance120.html.q1:

You said â{answer}â Is this correct?
No, I meant something else. Yes, that is correct.
seance120.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

Did you feel that? I feel like something has changed.
...

seance140.html.candle:
A hint of uncertainty punctures the mood. You were so preoccupied with the absurdity of it all that any subtlety of nuance was lost in the moment. Before you could reply, the spirit continued.
...
seance140.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

.img	{filter:grayscale(0.1) brightness(1.3) invert(0.8); animation:half_show 3s steps(40,end), glitch 2s infinite linear alternate-reverse; mask-image:linear-gradient(to top, transparent 15%, black);}

Surely you felt that.
Do you sense anything at all?
...

seance180.html.candle:
As the spirit pauses to observe itself, you wonder about the questions ~ they seem so specific and personal, yet at the same time so distant and clinical. You find yourself start to mouth a reply but the spirit went on.
...
seance180.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

.img	{filter:grayscale(1) brightness(1) invert(0.3); animation:half_show 3s steps(40,end),glitch 2s infinite linear alternate-reverse; mask-image:linear-gradient(to top, transparent 10%, black);}

seance210.html.q1:
Spirit
It is happening again.
You must notice what I'm seeing, surely?
...
seance210.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance220.html.candle:
There was no doubt ~ something was definitely happening to the spirit right before your very eyes but neither of you could figure out why this was the case. The questioning continues.
...
seance220.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance240.html.q1:

You said â{answer}â Is this correct?

seance250.html.css:
.img	{filter:grayscale(1) brightness(1); animation:half_show 3s steps(40,end),glitch 2s infinite linear alternate-reverse; mask-image:linear-gradient(to top, transparent 5%, black);}
.talky	{animation:slow_show 2.5s steps(140,end);}
seance250.html.q1:
Spirit
Your answers are changing me. Can you see that?
...
seance250.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance260.html.candle:
Is that true? Was the physical act of responding to the questions having an effect on this spirit? But how could that be? The Voice mentioned something earlier about resonating with humanity to manifest. Was this it? The spirit kept going.
...
seance260.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance270.html.q1:
Spirit
{question}
{answer}
seance270.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance280.html.q1:
Spirit
You said â{answer}â Is this correct?
No, I don't think so. Yes, that is right.

seance290.html.css:
.img	{filter:grayscale(0.5) brightness(1); animation:half_show 3s steps(40,end),glitch 2s infinite linear alternate-reverse; mask-image:linear-gradient(to top, transparent 2%, black);}
.talky	{animation:slow_show 2.5s steps(140,end);}
seance290.html.q1:
Spirit
Could this be? I feel almost whole again.
...
seance290.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance300.html.candle:
Almost whole. That must be it! The manifestation has taken place and you have been privy to it this whole time. Like a puzzle coming together piece by piece, the culmination of thoughts unfurl into view. The spirit picked up the pace.
...
seance300.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance310.html.q1:
Spirit
{question}
{answer}
seance310.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance320.html.q1:
Spirit
You said â{answer}â Is this correct?
No, that is wrong. Yes, that is correct.
seance320.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance330.html.candle:
With the last question answered, the spirit begins to convulse, glowing and pulsing a bright radiant hue of white and sky blue, slowly at first before increasing in speed and frequency. Then the spirit started to spin.
...
seance330.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance340.html.q1:
Voice
Ahh ~ interesting. The spirit seems stronger than it was before. What did you do?
...
seance340.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance350.html.candle:
True enough, no one could deny the difference of then and now. The vividness of colour, every brush stroke so tangible and clear. Absorbed by the sudden turn of events, the spirit becomes quiet as the Voice continues.
...
seance350.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance360.html.q1:
Voice
Indeed! It looks like the spirit has received a name and a memory of it's past. Go on ~ have a look.
Look
seance360.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance370.html.candle:
You looked on in wonderment as another piece of similar dimension and size, begins to separate itself from the spirit. Dark shapes, glyphs and letters begin to appear, lifting themselves from the surface to rearrange their positions in place.
...
seance370.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance390.html.candle:
The spirit now remembers who they are and how they came to be. With your help and sacrifice, they have been granted a voice of which they seem entirely indebted to you for. Amidst a flurry of whispers between them, the Voice remarked.
...
seance390.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance400.html.q1:
Voice
Ohh ~ how curious. The spirit wants to give you something. It looks like a letter but it might not be.
RECEIVE LETTER
seance400.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance410.html.letter_text: {letter} Yours truly, with love and understanding, {artist}
seance410.html.title: Dead Painters Seance

seance420.html.candle:
As you utter the last word of the letter out loud, the spirit looks at you contented. It gives you a slight nod before vanishing into thin air, almost as if it was never there to begin with.

The Voice remains silent.
...
seance420.html.title: Dead Painters Seance
